doc.previous: In November 2014, Airbus announced that it is designing a larger replacement type, will be based on the Airbus A330-200, five of which will start operating from 2019, replacing the last old Beluga in 2025.[9][10][11][12] Airbus previously considered the A330-300 and A340-500 to require too much of the limited 1,663 m (5,460 ft) runway 04 at Hawarden Airport near Broughton in Wales.[13]
